ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] twisting 5, added note
ygData.msgSnippet: ... No, because too many of the gamers don t have enough sense to do things more complicated than what occurred to them at random when they started. My wife
ygData.messageBody:
--- John Grady <john_grady@...> wrote:
> I agree Atonal. I mean Kaz, if it was as easy and beneficial as you
> describe don't you think a lot
> of Bards would be doing it? There's a lot of people on this list that have
> played them for 2+
> years and while very few of us may be "hard-core" gamers, the majority of
> us can key mash with the
> best of 'em.

No, because too many of the gamers don't have enough sense to do things more
complicated than what occurred to them at random when they started. My wife
has been playing for a year longer than I have, and yet /she/ still uses the
newbie screen, only uses the few most basic social macros that everyone was
telling newbies to write way back when she started, et cetera. I suspect that
she's learned as much about the game because of my play than she'd learned
the entire year before that. Hell, she doesn't even link skills to movement
keys...I link sense heading to left/right, loc to forward, and other skills
(forage, mend, et cetera) to center or forward as necessary, for example, and
she not only still won't, but didn't even know /how/ to link buttons until I
showed her.

=====
